contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=August 2009}} '''Jordan Frieda''' (born June 17, 1977) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] actor. He is the son of [[Scotland|Scottish]] singer [[Lulu (singer)|Lulu]] and celebrity hair stylist [[John Frieda]] and was educated at [[Eton College]] (and briefly at [[The King's School, Canterbury]]) and [[Gonville and Caius College]], [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge University]]. He had a small part in [[Steven Spielberg]]'s TV mini series ''[[Band of Brothers (TV miniseries)|Band of Brothers]]'' and took the lead role in a controversial American TV movie called ''Prince William'', filmed in 2002, in [[Dublin, Ireland]], about [[Prince William, Duke of Cambridge|Prince William of Wales]], with whom Frieda attended [[Eton College]]. He also appeared in the 2004 film ''Out of Season'' which starred [[Dennis Hopper]]. Frieda is co-owner of the Trullo restaurant in London's [[Islington]] area, which opened in 2010.<ref>[http://www.hot-dinners.com/Features/Interviews/true-love-for-trullo-jordan-frieda-tim-siadatan-interview Hot Dinners - interview with Jordan Frieda about Trullo (22 July 2010)]</ref> ==Personal life== Frieda's first child, Isabella Rose, was born on 29 December 2009.<ref>[http://www.hellomagazine.com/celebrities-news-in-pics/21-01-2010/53026/ Hello Magazine (21 Jan 2010)]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Frieda, Jordan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = June 17, 1977 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Frieda, Jordan}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:British actors]]
